title: .git folder exposed [HtUS]
content:
Heyy there,
I have found a exposed .git folder on https://█████
https://████████/.git/config
Code 175 Bytes
1[core]
2	repositoryformatversion = 0
3	filemode = true
4	bare = false
5	logallrefupdates = true
6[remote "origin"]
7	url = https://████
8	fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*
9
Using gitdumper (https://github.com/internetwache/GitTools) , I was able to dump the whole .git directory and later was able to get access to the whole source code of the ███ application.
Code 12.88 KiB

By just looking at some interesting files such as config.js, I found the credentials for the database:
/private/config.json
Code 413 Bytes
1{
2	    // DATABASE_HOST
3    // Database host to connect to
4    
5    "DATABASE_HOST":"localhost",
6    
7    // DATABASE_USER
8    // Name of the database user to connect as
9    
10    "DATABASE_USER":"███",
11    
12    // DATABASE_PASSWORD
13    // Password to connect with
14    
15    "DATABASE_PASSWORD":"█████████",
16    
17    // DATABASE_NAME
18    // Name of the Authoring Tools database
19    
20    "DATABASE_NAME":"███████",
21}
And another interesting file where I found user email addresses and password hashes: /private/install.xml
Code 771 Bytes

The information disclosed in above two files is really very sensitive, I haven't looked much into other files but I am pretty sure there will be much more things like this in the source code.
Impact
An attacker by dumping the whole source code , can find credentials such as I have shown in my report (db creds, administrator creds) and also they will have full access to the source code of the application.

steps: Identify the exposed .git folder by accessing https://█████/.git/config
Use GitTools (gitdumper) to clone the entire repository from the exposed .git folder
Analyze the cloned repository to find sensitive files like config.json and install.xml containing database credentials and user information
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves an exposed .git folder on a web server, which allows attackers to download the entire source code repository. This leads to information disclosure of sensitive data including database credentials and user account details stored in configuration files.
reason: The attack is straightforward once the .git folder is discovered. It involves a single component (the exposed .git folder) and standard tools to exploit it. The interaction is obvious - accessing the folder leads directly to source code exposure.
